entry.title: Paws In Action: Training Dogs For Search And Rescue

media:group.media:title: Paws In Action: Training Dogs For Search And Rescue
media:group.media:description:
CivilNet is exploring the efforts of the Armenian Malinois Project, a volunteer search and rescue (SAR) team using Belgian Malinois dogsโthe first of its kind in Armenia. Led by Raffy Ardhaldjian, this nonprofit civic resilience organization is preparing its team for international certification to effectively respond to both natural and manmade disasters. Join us as we meet the volunteers and their dogs, who are preparing to save lives and enhance Armenia's emergency response capabilities.

ยซิฑึึีกีญีตีกีถ ีคีซีฟีกีถีฏีตีกีถยป ีฐีฅึีฉีกีฏีกีถ ีฉีธีฒีกึีฏีดีกีถีจ ึีกีฒีกึีกีฏีกีถ ีพีฅึีฌีธึีฎีกีขีกีถ ีีซีฃึีกีถ ิณึีซีฃีธึีตีกีถีถ ีธึ ีฌึีกีฃึีธีฒ ิบีกีถีถีก ิฑีพีกีฃีตีกีถีจ ึีถีถีกึีฏีธึีด ีฅีถ ิฑีคึีขีฅีปีกีถีธึีด ีกึีฟีกีฐีฅึีฉ ีถีกีญีกีฃีกีฐีกีฏีกีถ ีจีถีฟึีธึีฉีตีธึีถีถีฅึีซ ีกีถึีฏีกึีดีกีถ ีธึีธีทีธึีดีจึ ินีธีฒีกึีฏีดีกีถ ีจีถีฉีกึึีธึีด ีกีถีคึีกีคีกึีฑ ีง ีฏีกีฟีกึีพีธึีด ีถีกึ ีีกีตีกีฝีฟีกีถีซ ีธึ ิฑีคึีขีฅีปีกีถีซ ีฟีกึีกีฎีกีฎ ีฐีกีดีกีฟีฅีฒ ีฐีกีตีฟีกึีกึีธึีฉีตีกีถีจ, ีซีถีนีบีฅีฝ ีถีกึ ิผีฅีผีถีกีตีซีถ ีีกึีกีขีกีฒีซ ีกีถีฏีกีญีธึีฉีตีกีถ ีฐีกีถึีกึีพีฅีซ ึ ึีจี ีคีฅีฏีฟีฅีดีขีฅึีซ 10-ีซีถ, ีกึึีกีญีตีกีถ ีดีซ ีทีกึึ ีฏีกีฆีดีกีฏีฅึีบีธึีฉีตีธึีถีถีฅึีซ ีธึ ีฏีธึีฝีกีฏึีธึีฉีตีธึีถีถีฅึีซ ีฐีกีตีฟีกึีกึีธึีฉีตีกีถีจึ

ิฟีกีบีกีถ ีฐีกีดีกีตีถึีซ ีฝีกีฐีดีกีถีกีดีฅึีฑ ีึีกีทีฅีถ ีฃีตีธึีฒีซ ิฑีขึีกีฐีกีดีตีกีถีถีฅึีซ ีจีถีฟีกีถีซึีจ ึีกีถีฏีกีถีธึีด ีง ึ ีฃีฟีพีฅีฌ ีบีฅีฟีธึีฉีตีกีถ ึีซีถีกีถีฝีกีพีธึีดีกีดีข ีฝีฅึีกีฏีกีถ ีฟีธึีถ ีฏีกีผีธึึีฅีฌีธึ ีฎึีกีฃึีซึึ ีีกีฏีกีตีถ, ีซีถีนีบีฅีฝ ีซึีฅีถึ ีฅีถ ีกีฝีธึีด, ีคึีก ีฐีถีกึีกีพีธึีธึีฉีตีธึีถีจ ีนีซ ีฟึีพีธึีด, ีธึีธีพีฐีฅีฟึ ีกึีคีฅีถ ีฟีธึีถ ีธึีถีฅีถ, ีนีถีกีตีกีฎี ีกีตีถ ีฏีซีฝีกึีกีถีค ีง ีธึ ีผีดีขีกีฏีธีฎีพีกีฎึ ีึีกีทีฅีถึีซีถีฅึีจ ีฝีบีกีฝีธึีด ีฅีถ, ีธึ ีซึีฅีถึ ีญีถีคีซึีถีฅึีซีถ ีงีฌ ีดีซ ึ ึ ีธึีทีกีคึีธึีฉีตีธึีถ ีฏีคีกึีฑีถีฅีถึ

entry.title: Harnessing Buried Riches to Bolster Armenian Autonomy

media:group.media:title: Harnessing Buried Riches to Bolster Armenian Autonomy
media:group.media:description:
In this episode of the Civilnet podcast, host Patrick Elliott interviews Artyom Geghamyan, Director of Armeniaโs International Chamber for Mining, about modernizing and diversifying the country's extractive sector. They discuss opportunities to harness Armenia's mineral wealth for economic and energy security while balancing environmental protection. Insights are shared on how strategic mining projects and sector reforms can attract critical foreign investment to further unleash Armenia's underground untapped potential.

entry.title: โItโs time to break free from an outdated education system,โ Larisa Hovannisian

media:group.media:title: โItโs time to break free from an outdated education system,โ Larisa Hovannisian
media:group.media:description:
In this episode, we explore the life of Larisa Hovannisian, from her childhood and education in Yerevan, Moscow, Wisconsin, and Phoenix to her life as the founder and CEO of Teach for Armenia. We explore important topics such as her family roots, her journey in establishing Teach for Armenia, and the challenges and drives that helped her become a successful social entrepreneur. Finally, Larisa shares her view on the importance of faith, self-belief, life purpose, parenthood, social-emotional learning, and the role of education today.
About Larisa Hovannisian
Larisa Hovannisian is the founder and CEO of Teach for Armenia, a social impact organization dedicated to catalyzing impact-driven leaders addressing educational inequity for all children in Armenia and formerly in Artsakh. She holds a double degree in International Business and French, a minor in Graphic Design from St. Norbert College in De Pere, Wisconsin, and a masterโs degree in special education from Arizona State University. As an educational activist, Larisa was nationally recognized by the Armenian government in 2016 for her contribution to the advancement of Armenia through her work with Teach for Armenia.
Program Overview Mindful Leaders dives into the stories of people who have achieved prominence, walked incredible journeys, and have defined culture.
Lara sits down with specialists, thinkers, and change catalysts to deconstruct insights, events, and lessons that have shaped their personal and professional lives and have enabled them to create meaning and connection.
00:00 Intro 1:06 Early childhood 4:23 Historical narratives of trauma 9:00 Leading through challenges; having purpose and faith 14:30 Parenthood, fulfillment and unlocking our talents 16:50 Social-emotional learning and the future of education with AI 24:15 Teach for Armenia and organizational culture 30:36 Grandparents Leonid Gurunts and Larisa Isahakyan; learning from our history 36:13 Conclusion and final reflections

media:group.media:description:
ีีกีดีกีฟีฅีฒ ีตีกีตีฟีกึีกึีธึีฉีซึีถีจ, ีธึ ึีกีฒีกึีกีฃีงีฟ ีคีธีฏีฟ. ิฑีฝีบีฅีฟ ิณีธีนีซีฏีฅีกีถีซ ีฏีกึีฎีซึีธีพ ีซีฝีฏีกีบีงีฝ ีซึีกีฏีกีถีกึีกีฎ ีง ีกีผีกีถึ ีดีซีปีถีธึีคีซ, ีีกีตีกีฝีฟีกีถีซีถ ีฅึ ิฑีฟึีบีงีตีณีกีถีซีถ ีฏึีถีกีต ีกึีฅีฌีซ ีดึ ีฟีฅึีถีฅีฌ ีญีกีฒีกีฒีธึีฉีฅีกีถ ีบีกีตีดีกีถีกีฃึีซ ีฝีฟีธึีกีฃึีธึีฉีฅีกีถึ ิฒีธีพีกีถีคีกีฏีธึีฉีฅีถีงีถ ีกึีฅีฌีซ, ีดีซีกึีฅีกีฌ ีตีกีตีฟีกึีกึีธึีฉีซึีถ ีฐึีกีบีกึีกีฏีฅีฌีธึ ึีกีฝีฟีจ ิณีธีนีซีฏีฅีกีถีซ ีฐีกีดีกึ ีซีถึีถีซีถ ีตีกีฟีฏีกีถีทีกีฏีกีถ ีง, ีธึีธีพีฐีฅีฟีฅึ ีฏีีฅีถีฉีกีคึีง, ีธึ ีฅึีฏีธึ ีฏีธีฒีดีฅึีจ ีธึีฒีฒีกีฏีซ ีขีกีถีกีฏึีฅีฌีธีพ ีฏึึีกีฎ ีฅีถ ีฃีฟีถีฅีฌ ีธึีธีท ีฐีกีฝีกึีกีฏีกึ ีฅีฆึีฅึ, ีธึีธีถึ ีฏึีถีกีถ ีฐีซีดึ ีฎีกีผีกีตีฅีฌ ีจีถีคีฐีกีถีธึึ ีฃีธึีฎีจีถีฉีกึีซ ีกีผีกีปีจีถีฉีกึีซีถึ
ีีซีพีซีฌีถีฅีฉีซ ยซีึีธึยป ีฐีกึีฉีกีฏีงีถ ีฆึีธีตึีจ ีพีกึีฅึ ิฑีขึ ีีธีฒีซีฏีฅีกีถึ
